name: Singita Lebombo Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't say enough wonderful things about Lebombo -- our safari guides were great, the food was fantastic, the service was out of this world. The hotel combines fabulous style and luxury with a very solid safari experience. It also feels younger and cooler than most of the luxury safaris, which was fun...
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was incredible -- We were so impressed with how every detail was taken care of -- from all the nibbles throughout the day, to the ipods in your room, the cool towels when it was hot, the blankets provided when it was cold... the wine cellar carved into the tree...

reviews.title: absolutely wonderful!
reviews.text: This was a truly great experience. From the minute we arrived at the Satara airstrip until we took off again for Johannesburg, we were awed and amazed by Singita and Kruger Park.

reviews.title: Hard to beat!
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights at Lebombo and loved every minute of our stay. The accomodations were excellent, the food very good and the service superb. The game drives were exciting and exhilarating. Our ranger, Jared, and our tracker, Glass, never failed to interest us with stories and adventures. We saw the big five and 500 + other animals, insects and birds. We traveled all over the concession in the early morning and the late afternoon, loving every minute ot it. We traveled in early winter (June) and the weather was perfect, 40's in the early morning and 80's in the afternoon. Kudos to Singita for making our first safari such a pleasure!

reviews.title: If this isn't one of the best experiences in your life, throw me to the lions
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from our trip to South Africa (Cape Town and Kruger National Park). We spent three nights at the Singita Lebombo and it is one of the best experiences we've ever have.

reviews.title: Absolutely superb
reviews.text: The first part of our trip was Cape Town so we flew SA from Cape Town to Mpumalanga, which is the closest airport to Kruger, on a direct (2 hours) flight. After gathering our luggage and exiting the baggage claim area, we were met by someone from Federal Air to guide us to our charter flight. The charter flight takes us directly to Satara Airstrip inside the Kruger National Park. As soon as exiting the plane, we were immediately greeted by a Singita staff (December was his name, it'll be hard to forget such a name!). He handed us cold towels and showed us the resting area and offered us refreshments and snacks while we waited for our bags to be unloaded from the plane. We tried wurst and biltongs (beef jerky) for the first time and in my opinion, it's better than slim jim.

reviews.title: Amazing Safari Lodge
reviews.text: After the bags have been transferred to the Singita vehicle, we took a 30 minute ride through the park to the lodge. On the way to the lodge, we saw Kudus, Wildebeests, Giraffes, and Impalas. Our driver, who is also one of the safari guides, will stop and let us take pictures and tell us about the animals.

reviews.title: Happy at Sweni
reviews.text: We just returned from Singita Sweni. We stayed here two days and two days at Singita Boulders. Sweni is the Ian Schrager of safari lodges. Very hip, funky decor. Young, friendly, obliging staff. There are no plunge pools here, which suprised us. We were two of three guests at the Lodge, so we had a lot of attentive service. The food and wines were superb. The management was really accomodating. They did some nice things for honeymooners, such as a dinner on our terrace by candlelight and a champagne bubble bath. Another night we had dinner in a boma with dancers. The spa is tiny, but the treatments were really good. The prices compare to those in the States. Our tracker Xipho and ranger Dale were wonderful and warm. The animal game viewing at Sweni is nowhere as good as at Singita boulders, however, the staff is much more enthusiastic and obliging here.

aka: Singita Lebombo Hotel Kruger National Park
description: Kruger National Park, north-east of Johannesburg, boasts a truly unique lodge. Guests stay in scarcely visible lofts perched like eagle nests on stilts built into the top of basalt cliffs. The rooms with floor-to-ceiling glass walls look onto breathtaking scenery and a setting renowned for its concentration of game.
